title: Fake News: It's NOT Official, Michelle Obama NOT Running For President | Lead Stories
subtitle: Is Michelle Obama running for president and is it official now? No, that's not true. The story was published by...
author: leadstories.com
vclaim:
Is Michelle Obama running for president and is it official now? No, that's not true. The story was published by a liberal satire website that tries to mislead Trump supporters and Republicans into sharing made up stories that are clearly marked as satire when you actually click them. Articles from the site are frequently copied by foreign-run fake news websites. The people liking and sharing these stories are enriching foreign website operators (or a liberal from Maine) via the ad revenue generated with the content which is probably not what they expected or wanted.

The story originated from an article published by bustatroll.org on October 20, 2019 titled "It's Official: Michelle Obama Running For President" (archived here) which opened:

For months now, there has been speculation of a surprise candidate that would emerge from the Democrats in the race for the White House. Now it seems she has revealed herself. Michelle Obama is expected to make the formal announcement of her intention to run on Monday morning. The announcement comes as no surprise to many. Mrs Obama has hinted for years of her desire to join her husband in politics. She sees her family as being "destined" in some way to lead America and says "Not doing so would be a disservice to the citizens."

Users on social media only saw this title, description and thumbnail:

But the story was posted in a category that read "Satire and/or Conservative Fan Fiction" and it had a picture of two puppies with this caption: "Puppy shots in all my satirical stories." In addition to that there were several other satire warnings and logos scattered on the page and website. The footer of the page literally explains the goal of the site is trolling conservatives: "COPYRIGHT 1776-2197 BY PAID LIBERAL TROLLS OF AMERICA".

Michelle Obama has indicated in the past there is "zero chance" she'll make a run for president:

The site bustatroll.org is part of the "America's Last Line of Defense" network of satire websites run byself-professed liberal troll Christopher Blair from Maine along with a loose confederation of friends and allies. Blair has been in a feud with fact checking website Snopes for some time now and has also criticized other fact checkers in the past who labeled his work "fake news" instead of satire. In reaction to this he has recently rebranded all his active websites and Facebook pages so they carry extremely visible disclaimers everywhere.

Every site in the network has an about page that reads (in part):

About Satire

Before you complain and decide satire is synonymous with "comedy": sat·ire

ˈsaˌtī(ə)r

noun

The use of humor, irony, exaggeration, or ridicule to expose and criticize people's stupidity or vices, particularly in the context of contemporary politics and other topical issues. Everything on this website is fiction. It is not a lie and it is not fake news because it is not real. If you believe that it is real, you should have your head examined. Any similarities between this site's pure fantasy and actual people, places, and events are purely coincidental and all images should be considered altered and satirical. See above if you're still having an issue with that satire thing.

Articles from Blair's sites frequently get copied by "real" fake news sites who often omit the satire disclaimer and any other hints the stories are fake. Blair has tried to get these sites shut down in the past but new ones keep cropping up.
